name: Prisoner Squat
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes facing forward.
2. Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your weight in your heels.

3. Keep the other foot lifted off the ground and rest it on the ball of that foot.

4. Lower yourself down until your rear knee is almost touching the ground and your front thigh is parallel to the ground.

5. Push through your front heel to return to standing, keeping a slight bend in your knee.
6. Step back with the front foot to return to the starting position.
short_summary: The prisoner squat is a bodyweight exercise that targets the legs, particularly the quadriceps and gluteus maximus, performed by stepping forward into a squat position with one foot while keeping the other foot lifted.
